content: this is a summary of a legal case in slovenia identified as case n° sodba vrhovnega sodišča rs ii ips 1632017 25 9 2017 the supreme court made a decision on september 25 2017 but the details of the case are not provided the case involves two parties and the supreme court reviewed the case and made a judgment the judgment states that the defendant is required to pay a total of 123647 eur the court has made a decision regarding the costs involved the legal procedure lasted until september 25 2017 the final resolution of the case involves a judgment on a real estate property specifically an apartment the division of ownership is determined with the plaintiff owning 1533 and the defendant owning 1567 the court of appeal confirmed the decision made by the supreme court the supreme court considered previous cases and concluded that the defense of special property does not extend to a higher share of coowned property the defendants conduct in the case must be assessed based on the individual circumstances the judgment in the case was revised and the court of first instances decision was amended the applicants appeal was dismissed and the original judgment was upheld the costs of the appeal proceedings were ordered to be paid by the applicant the applicant is also required to reimburse the defendant for the costs of the review proceedings within 15 days of receiving the judgment the amount to be reimbursed is 123647 eur plus interest at the statutory rate the applicant in this case requested the court to rule on a disputed apartment claiming that it belonged to both parties as joint property the court of first instance partially upheld the applicants claim finding that the parties had lived together and that the apartment was purchased during their cohabitation the court determined that the defendant had invested a certain amount in the purchase of the apartment but since the purchase price was higher the applicants coownership interest was determined to be 1533 the supreme court later reviewed the case and set aside the judgment of the court of first instance for failing to respond to the defendants claim of a greater share of the coowned property the court of second instance partially upheld the applicants appeal and ruled that the parties had a 50 share in the apartment the court also reconsidered the applicants appeal and dismissed it in part the supreme court allowed the appeal in this case the court is deciding whether a plea for a higher share of a coowned property is necessary one party claims to have 100 ownership of the property but the court has criticized the claim stating that both parties have previously agreed to a 100 share the applicant argues that their right to justice has been affected and refers to previous supreme court decisions the applicant requested the annulment of previous court decisions and a retrial the court found the objection to be unfounded and ruled in favor of the applicant for a 1533 share of the assets the court allowed the defendants review and amended the judgment of the court of first instance dismissing the plaintiffs appeal and upholding the original judgment the court also ordered the applicant to reimburse the defendant for the costs of the review proceedings
